Articles.Content: If you use Mac computers/laptops with KSP, you can chat about preformance, mods, etc.... I use an M1 chip Mac and it runs great with stock, and OK with heavy modding.

On 4/21/2021 at 9:15 AM, Rhode_Enterprise_By-Matt said:

If you use Mac computers/laptops with KSP, you can chat about preformance, mods, etc.... I use an M1 chip Mac and it runs great with stock, and OK with heavy modding.

What M1 are you running? I am looking to replace my 27" iMac, and I was thinking of just getting a mini in the short term until I can get a new (large) iMac. My thought is to get one in stock (which is only 8GB ram, boo), because I fully expect to drop a few grand on whatever the 27" replacement is, even if it's closer to an iMac Pro than a regular one.

I have a mini

3 hours ago, Rhode_Enterprise_By-Matt said:

If anyone was wondering the new m1 Mac from Apple gets 10 fps when on the ground when running parallax and beyond home, and gets 40-60 fps when in space. (Again with beyond home) I also run a ton of part packs and even got another star system pack called vulture. 

30-50 fps in atmosphere.

<Quoted from me 3 hours ago>

Just to clarify, RAM is not an issue on the M1 Mac mini when running stock or light mods.

Edited April 26, 2021 by Rhode_Enterprise_By-Matt

3 minutes ago, Rhode_Enterprise_By-Matt said:

Hope this helps.

You have the 8 gig version?

The only reason not to order a 16gb for me is impatience, lol, I can pick up a mini today but they only have 8GB in stock. I plan on selling it, trading it in, or giving it to my in-laws once a 32" (!?) iMac is a thing, ideally with M1X or M2, and maybe a discrete ARM GPU.

I have 8g, yes, but it handles 18g power by offloading RAM usage onto the hard drive.

When my hard drive space was running low my KSP wouldn’t run.
10 fps is pretty lousy, that seems surprising. My 2013 beats that handily. Guess it's Rosetta 2 since it's not optimized?
Techie-kind of a thread has been moved to the techie subforum.

On 4/27/2021 at 6:13 PM, tater said:

10 fps is pretty lousy, that seems surprising. My 2013 beats that handily. Guess it's Rosetta 2 since it's not optimized?

No, it’s because of how many mods I am making it handle.
I honestly forgot how to check the FPS, seems buttery enough on my M1 with everything turned to max
